definition[0]: to surround someone or something so that they are unable to move freely
example[0]: Someone had parked right behind them, boxing them in.
definition[1]: to feel that you cannot do what you want to do because a person or situation is limiting you
example[1]: Married for only a year, Connie already felt boxed in.
definition[2]: to feel that you cannot move freely, because you are in a small space
